speaker: IACHIMO
text: Believe it, sir, I have seen him in Britain. He

speaker: IACHIMO
text: was then of a crescent note, expected to prove so

speaker: IACHIMO
text: worthy as since he hath been allowed the name of.

speaker: IACHIMO
text: But I could then have looked on him without the

speaker: IACHIMO
text: help of admiration, though the catalogue of his

speaker: IACHIMO
text: endowments had been tabled by his side and I to

speaker: IACHIMO
text: peruse him by items.

speaker: PHILARIO
text: You speak of him when he was less furnished

speaker: PHILARIO
text: than now he is with that which makes him

speaker: PHILARIO
text: both without and within.

speaker: FRENCHMAN
text: I have seen him in France. We had very

speaker: FRENCHMAN
text: many there could behold the sun with as firm eyes

speaker: FRENCHMAN
text: as he.

speaker: IACHIMO
text: This matter of marrying his king’s daughter,

speaker: IACHIMO
text: wherein he must be weighed rather by her value

speaker: IACHIMO
text: than his own, words him, I doubt not, a great deal

speaker: IACHIMO
text: from the matter.

speaker: FRENCHMAN
text: And then his banishment.

speaker: IACHIMO
text: Ay, and the approbation of those that weep

speaker: IACHIMO
text: this lamentable divorce under her colors are wonderfully

speaker: IACHIMO
text: to extend him, be it but to fortify her judgment,

speaker: IACHIMO
text: which else an easy battery might lay flat for

speaker: IACHIMO
text: taking a beggar without less quality.—But how

speaker: IACHIMO
text: comes it he is to sojourn with you? How creeps

speaker: IACHIMO
text: acquaintance?

speaker: PHILARIO
text: His father and I were soldiers together, to

speaker: PHILARIO
text: whom I have been often bound for no less than my

speaker: PHILARIO
text: life.

speaker: PHILARIO
text: Here comes the Briton. Let him be so entertained

speaker: PHILARIO
text: amongst you as suits, with gentlemen of your knowing,

speaker: PHILARIO
text: to a stranger of his quality.—I beseech you all,

speaker: PHILARIO
text: be better known to this gentleman, whom I commend

speaker: PHILARIO
text: to you as a noble friend of mine. How worthy

speaker: PHILARIO
text: he is I will leave to appear hereafter rather

speaker: PHILARIO
text: than story him in his own hearing.

speaker: FRENCHMAN
text: Sir, we have known together

speaker: FRENCHMAN
text: in Orleans.

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: Since when I have been debtor to you for

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: courtesies which I will be ever to pay and yet pay

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: still.

speaker: FRENCHMAN
text: Sir, you o’errate my poor kindness. I was

speaker: FRENCHMAN
text: glad I did atone my countryman and you. It had

speaker: FRENCHMAN
text: been pity you should have been put together with

speaker: FRENCHMAN
text: so mortal a purpose as then each bore, upon importance

speaker: FRENCHMAN
text: of so slight and trivial a nature.

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: By your pardon, sir, I was then a young

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: traveler, rather shunned to go even with what I

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: heard than in my every action to be guided by others’

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: experiences. But upon my mended judgment—

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: if I offend not to say it is mended—my

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: quarrel was not altogether slight.

speaker: FRENCHMAN
text: Faith, yes, to be put to the arbitrament of

speaker: FRENCHMAN
text: swords, and by such two that would by all likelihood

speaker: FRENCHMAN
text: have confounded one the other or have fall’n

speaker: FRENCHMAN
text: both.

speaker: IACHIMO
text: Can we with manners ask what was the

speaker: IACHIMO
text: difference?

speaker: FRENCHMAN
text: Safely, I think. ’Twas a contention in public,

speaker: FRENCHMAN
text: which may without contradiction suffer the report.

speaker: FRENCHMAN
text: It was much like an argument that fell out

speaker: FRENCHMAN
text: last night, where each of us fell in praise of our

speaker: FRENCHMAN
text: country mistresses, this gentleman at that time

speaker: FRENCHMAN
text: vouching—and upon warrant of bloody affirmation—

speaker: FRENCHMAN
text: his to be more fair, virtuous, wise, chaste,

speaker: FRENCHMAN
text: constant, qualified, and less attemptable than any

speaker: FRENCHMAN
text: the rarest of our ladies in France.

speaker: IACHIMO
text: That lady is not now living, or this gentleman’s

speaker: IACHIMO
text: opinion by this worn out.

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: She holds her virtue still, and I my mind.

speaker: IACHIMO
text: You must not so far prefer her ’fore ours of

speaker: IACHIMO
text: Italy.

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: Being so far provoked as I was in France,

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: I would abate her nothing, though I profess myself

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: her adorer, not her friend.

speaker: IACHIMO
text: As fair and as good—a kind of hand-in-hand

speaker: IACHIMO
text: comparison—had been something too fair and too

speaker: IACHIMO
text: good for any lady in Britain. If she went before

speaker: IACHIMO
text: others I have seen, as that diamond of yours outlusters

speaker: IACHIMO
text: many I have beheld, I could not but

speaker: IACHIMO
text: believe she excelled many. But I have not seen the

speaker: IACHIMO
text: most precious diamond that is, nor you the lady.

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: I praised her as I rated her. So do I my

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: stone.

speaker: IACHIMO
text: What do you esteem it at?

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: More than the world enjoys.

speaker: IACHIMO
text: Either your unparagoned mistress is dead, or

speaker: IACHIMO
text: she’s outprized by a trifle.

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: You are mistaken. The one may be sold or

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: given, or if there were wealth enough for the purchase

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: or merit for the gift. The other is not a thing

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: for sale, and only the gift of the gods.

speaker: IACHIMO
text: Which the gods have given you?

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: Which, by their graces, I will keep.

speaker: IACHIMO
text: You may wear her in title yours, but you

speaker: IACHIMO
text: know strange fowl light upon neighboring ponds.

speaker: IACHIMO
text: Your ring may be stolen too. So your brace of unprizable

speaker: IACHIMO
text: estimations, the one is but frail and the

speaker: IACHIMO
text: other casual. A cunning thief or a that-way-accomplished

speaker: IACHIMO
text: courtier would hazard the winning both of

speaker: IACHIMO
text: first and last.

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: Your Italy contains none so accomplished

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: a courtier to convince the honor of my mistress, if

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: in the holding or loss of that, you term her frail. I

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: do nothing doubt you have store of thieves;

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: notwithstanding, I fear not my ring.

speaker: PHILARIO
text: Let us leave here, gentlemen.

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: Sir, with all my heart. This worthy signior,

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: I thank him, makes no stranger of me. We are

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: familiar at first.

speaker: IACHIMO
text: With five times so much conversation I

speaker: IACHIMO
text: should get ground of your fair mistress, make her

speaker: IACHIMO
text: go back even to the yielding, had I admittance and

speaker: IACHIMO
text: opportunity to friend.

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: No, no.

speaker: IACHIMO
text: I dare thereupon pawn the moiety of my

speaker: IACHIMO
text: estate to your ring, which in my opinion o’ervalues

speaker: IACHIMO
text: it something. But I make my wager rather against

speaker: IACHIMO
text: your confidence than her reputation, and, to bar

speaker: IACHIMO
text: your offense herein too, I durst attempt it against

speaker: IACHIMO
text: any lady in the world.

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: You are a great deal abused in too bold a

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: persuasion, and I doubt not you sustain what

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: you’re worthy of by your attempt.

speaker: IACHIMO
text: What’s that?

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: A repulse—though your attempt, as you

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: call it, deserve more: a punishment, too.

speaker: PHILARIO
text: Gentlemen, enough of this. It came in too

speaker: PHILARIO
text: suddenly. Let it die as it was born, and, I pray you,

speaker: PHILARIO
text: be better acquainted.

speaker: IACHIMO
text: Would I had put my estate and my neighbor’s

speaker: IACHIMO
text: on th’ approbation of what I have spoke.

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: What lady would you choose to assail?

speaker: IACHIMO
text: Yours, whom in constancy you think stands

speaker: IACHIMO
text: so safe. I will lay you ten thousand ducats to your

speaker: IACHIMO
text: ring that, commend me to the court where your

speaker: IACHIMO
text: lady is, with no more advantage than the opportunity

speaker: IACHIMO
text: of a second conference, and I will bring from

speaker: IACHIMO
text: thence that honor of hers which you imagine so

speaker: IACHIMO
text: reserved.

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: I will wage against your gold, gold to it.

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: My ring I hold dear as my finger; ’tis part of it.

speaker: IACHIMO
text: You are a friend, and therein the wiser. If you

speaker: IACHIMO
text: buy ladies’ flesh at a million a dram, you cannot

speaker: IACHIMO
text: preserve it from tainting. But I see you have some

speaker: IACHIMO
text: religion in you, that you fear.

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: This is but a custom in your tongue. You

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: bear a graver purpose, I hope.

speaker: IACHIMO
text: I am the master of my speeches and would

speaker: IACHIMO
text: undergo what’s spoken, I swear.

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: Will you? I shall but lend my diamond till

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: your return. Let there be covenants drawn between

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: ’s. My mistress exceeds in goodness the hugeness

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: of your unworthy thinking. I dare you to this

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: match. Here’s my ring.

speaker: PHILARIO
text: I will have it no lay.

speaker: IACHIMO
text: By the gods, it is one!—If I bring you no sufficient

speaker: IACHIMO
text: testimony that I have enjoyed the dearest

speaker: IACHIMO
text: bodily part of your mistress, my ten thousand

speaker: IACHIMO
text: ducats are yours; so is your diamond too. If I come

speaker: IACHIMO
text: off and leave her in such honor as you have trust

speaker: IACHIMO
text: in, she your jewel, this your jewel, and my gold are

speaker: IACHIMO
text: yours, provided I have your commendation for my

speaker: IACHIMO
text: more free entertainment.

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: I embrace these conditions. Let us have

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: articles betwixt us. Only thus far you shall answer:

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: if you make your voyage upon her and give me directly

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: to understand you have prevailed, I am no

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: further your enemy; she is not worth our debate. If

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: she remain unseduced, you not making it appear

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: otherwise, for your ill opinion and th’ assault you

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: have made to her chastity, you shall answer me

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: with your sword.

speaker: IACHIMO
text: Your hand; a covenant.

speaker: IACHIMO
text: We will have these things set down by lawful counsel,

speaker: IACHIMO
text: and straight away for Britain, lest the bargain

speaker: IACHIMO
text: should catch cold and starve. I will fetch my gold

speaker: IACHIMO
text: and have our two wagers recorded.

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: Agreed.

speaker: FRENCHMAN
text: Will this hold, think you?

speaker: PHILARIO
text: Signior Iachimo will not from it. Pray, let us

speaker: PHILARIO
text: follow ’em.
